metadata.title: CVE-2018-20679 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in BusyBox before 1.30.0. An out of bounds read inudhcp components (consumed by the DHCP server, client, and relay) allows aremote attacker to leak sensitive information from the stack by sending acrafted DHCP message. This is related to verification in udhcp_get_option()in networking/udhcp/common.c that 4-byte options are indeed 4 bytes.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20679` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

busybox - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu5
busybox-initramfs - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu5
busybox-static - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu5
busybox-syslogd - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu5
udhcpc - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu5
udhcpd - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: busybox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.27.2-2ubuntu5').
